title: U.S. officials walk back claim drone strike killed senior al-Qaeda leader
description: The acknowledgement comes as terrorism experts and the dead man’s family have cast doubt on a Pentagon statement indicating the operation targeted an influential member of the terrorist organization

title: S.P. Hinduja, patriarch of British Indian business empire, dies at 87
description: Mr. Hinduja and his three bothers claimed the wealth from the Hinduja Group was shared equally. A battle over a Swiss bank has divided the family.

title: Europe’s military industrial capabilities fall short of Ukraine’s needs
description: Western governments have failed to act fast enough to turn around their industrial policy to meet Ukraine’s needs for weapons and ammunition, experts said.

title: Governments are moving to restrict TikTok over privacy, ties to China
description: Montana in May became the first U.S. state to ban TikTok. Numerous countries have placed restrictions on it, citing privacy concerns over ties to China.

title: New York car chase highlights Prince Harry’s mission to change the media
description: Harry says it is his mission in life is to change tabloid culture, which he believes not only pollutes the lives of media consumers, but is responsible for his own rift with the royal family.

title: Can’t take your mom to the hospital? In China, you can hire someone.
description: Covid has given rise to a new business in China: hospital escort services for elderly patients whose children are far away or busy working.

title: Fighting fire with goats
description: Their superpower: Eating. Uncomplainingly and just about unceasingly, the goats reduce the vegetation that dries up in the summer, reducing fuel for the flames.

title: The U.S. deported him. A Korean court says his adoption agency owes him.
description: Holt must compensate Adam Crapser, who was deported to a country whose language he did not speak, after his adoptive parents did not obtain citizenship for him.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Another missile attack jolts Kyiv; Patriot system still operational, U.S. says
description: Explosions rocked Kyiv, according to its mayor, as Russia continued its barrage of air strikes on the Ukrainian capital.

title: Haitians fight back against gangs, drawing support — and worry
description: In one incident, a mob pulled suspected gang members from police custody, hung gasoline-soaked tires around their necks and beat and burned them to death.

title: Leak suspect shared classified secrets with foreigners, prosecutors say
description: The Justice Department, in a court filing ahead of Jack Teixeira’s next detention hearing, also says it found red flags in his Air Force record.
